DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine extent two different reward system implement context multi-family pediatric weight management group differentially promote adoption healthy eating activity habit among overweight obese 8-17 year old youth . DOC.detailed_description: Pediatric overweight obesity significant public health concern , group base intervention incorporate behavioral , nutrition , activity discipline show modest success improve youth health weight status . The role financial reward encourage attendance weight management session acquisition healthy eating activity habit well understood context pediatric weight management , however . Behavior theory suggests positive reinforcement increase frequency desirable behavior . As , primary goal study evaluate role different reinforcement system increase healthy nutritional choice , increase physical activity , decrease sedentary activity among youth participate multifamily group base pediatric overweight/obesity intervention program . An additional aim study evaluate role different level reward decrease BMI among youth participate multifamily group base pediatric overweight/obesity intervention program . Participants randomly assign one two different reward condition : Condition A ( reward attendance ) Condition A+G ( reward attendance goal attainment ) . Up 80 participant recruited participate . Eligibility criterion include patient age 8-17 year , patient public insurance manage Children 's Community Health Network , English speaking patient parent , patient body mass index 85th percentile age sex . Exclusion criterion include : significant patient developmental cognitive delay , concurrent involvement another formal weight management program . Pre post intervention assessment anthropometric , psychosocial , nutritional , physical fitness variable conduct , participant complete 8 weekly multi-family group-based weight management intervention session involve psychology , physical therapy , dietitian discipline . Following intensive phase , family follow quarterly basis one year . Families receive financial reward attend program session ( Conditions A A+G ) complete behavioral monitoring assignment ( Condition A+G ) .
